caption: We arrived at this place for a meeting. my friend recommended this restaurant.  Well, it was a winning. The staff were extremely nice and we felt excellent. The food was just great. We loved this restaurant a lot and we shall absolutely come back again. Warmly recommended.
This place provides excellent service and enjoyable menu. One of my favourite spots around here. The food served fast and the rates were economical. Will definitely recommend this restaurant.
Food was excellent...service could be better.

The only reason this place gets one star is because the plates came out hot...the grilled chicken came out  raw, the server never brought our drinks. I got the crab cake sandwich that was very dry. Don’t recommend this place at all.
The food was delicious!!
Great food and reasonable prices
Nice view
too pricey for the lack of service and ok food.

Well, for years I have come to this Hyatt in Wasington, D.C.  It is typically a place for our meetings, and gatherings.  While there are happy hour drinks and appetizers, they are truly average and worst, expensive.  Margaritas or other drinks, really depend on the day, hour, and who makes it for you in at the bar.  Meals, like the Salmon salad, and grilled chicken are truly average in preparation and taste.  The expensive component is because the Hyatt is really at the heart and great location in D.C.   People service is always excellent!  Naturally, the personnel taking care of you do not make those meals or drinks, and they really are attentive to your needs!  However, my recommendation, try a few drinks while meeting people and go around the block, there are very fine places in a brief, nice, walking distance from the hotel.  You will be surprised how a couple of blocks, can make a world of difference in taste in food and drinks!

(Translated by Google) Very good restaurant inside the hotel. It is not very economical but it is a good option  (Original) muy buen restaurante dentro del hotel. no es muy económico pero es una buena opción
Restaurant served good meal. Reception was roomy and cozy.

The service here is excellent.  I had multiple servers checking on me to ensure I had everything I needed.  The bread with dinner is soft, warm and delicious.  The weekend all you can eat breakfast has a nice assortment of options and juices.
Food is always great, I enjoy it totally.
Wonderful
Domino's pizza is always good. It has a place for parties.

Great hotel restaurant! Usually hotel restaurants are just eh.  Appreciate the interesting menu with some organic and local ingredients... and even a sustainable catch of the day dish. Enjoyed the fluffy omelet, crispy hash browns and cheese plate for room service.
Very nice excellent service
Great service. Helpful staff gave us advice on meal options. Pulled pork and onion rings and the bean soup hit the spot after a day of walking. We took dessert for a late snack.
Great lunch spot. Quick, good quality, and fast service at reasonable prices.
Outstanding
Food was great, service was terribly slow
Great food
A good place to socialize and mingle with people

nice place right downstairs from our hotel room located across from the bar.Great for family's who arent familier with the area.A little bit pricey but saves you time trying to find a place to eat and the buffet is good a nice amount of things to choose from my kids are very picky they ate all their food we were stuffed
Excellent food, great for families!!!
Good food $$$ prices.  Children charged according to their age, if ordering from children menu.  Service is good.
I was able to customize breakfasts to fit my diet and budget
Very
The rack of lamb was tender and on point. The potatoes and steamed vegetables was also delicious.

We went there for dinner last night and was seated promptly.  However, we did not have a server come to our table.  We saw them serve others and clean tables.  We waited for 15 to 20 minutes before we decided to leave.
Excellent food, excellent service. Overall 5 star experience.
Had the tuna and some shrimp dumplings. Really tasty.

We’re staying at the hotel.  Went last night after visiting family for coffee and dessert.  The gentleman sent us to a table in the lobby bar area... not a table in the restaurant...with a dessert menu.  No one came over and after quite a while, we’d had enough.  We walked back and handed him the menu and started walking away.  It was only THEN that he offered to seat us in the restaurant and take our order!    I said thanks but too late.   It turns out there’s a Starbucks in the Market store and they were very accommodating!   I’m a Hyatt member (which shouldn’t make a difference) and we’re not kids...in our early 70’s.... but this shouldn’t be how guests or walk-ins are treated!   Is this a Hyatt policy or just a manager who doesn’t want to be bothered. My children live nearby so we’ll be staying at this Hyatt now.  We were never treated like this at the Park Hyatt or Crystal City.
Food was okay, the breakfast buffet was not that great but convenient. My coffee tasted burnt and the bacon was very greasy.
Huge portion of wings for $20
The crab soup was amazing affordable price will recommend
Bacano
I haven't had one subpar meal yet and the onion rings.... delicious! Equal parts onion and batter.
Food was good but pricey. Service was great

Had a bad experience here last night. Wrote a review on my experience. When I got back to my room today, had an apology, fruit bowl, drinks in my fridge and a coupon for a free meal and drinks. Went back tonight after a business dinner for a couple of beers. Got apology from the server from last, service was great. Some colleges joined me on ate a steak dinner and a couple of drinks. When we went to settle our bills, all was competed. If I could find the old review I would delete it. Class act for making it right.
DELICIOUS cuisine

Breakfast buffet is excellent - lots of variety, moderate price (don't miss that $25 off $50 dining coupon they offer with hotel reservation!), comfortable location right in the main lobby of the hotel.  Pre-cooked scrambled eggs/bacon are hit or miss -  were great one morning, but barely warm on another. Still, there is an omelet station - get it cooked to your specs right in front of you.  Coffee is consistently good. Plenty of cold cuts, pastries and fresh fruit. Haven't tried sausages or pancakes - but they looked/smelled good.  Bagels, oatmeal, yogurt, cereals - all typical breakfast staples. You won't leave hungry.

I was out walking around the museums all day and figured I'd give my feet a rest and give the hotel bar a chance despite the bad reviews. The hotel lobby is pretty and it's a nice space. Right off the bat, something felt off because someone was coming up to the bar because her waiter didn't bother to give her any utensils and the bartender wasn't giving her the time of day. The bartender took a while to acknowledge my presence and didn't seem to speak English very well. I ordered a couple of appetizers and I didn't finish either of them. They both tasted cheap and weren't particularly interesting. I had a couple of beers as well ($8/each). I thought they might do mixed drinks better, so I ordered an old fashioned. It was okay. Not great. They charged me $19 for it though, and that's where they lost me. My total (with tip) was $83. That was not an $83 meal. If I was paying $35 for that meal in Morgantown, WV I'd have no complaints, but for $83 in DC I could've walked across the street and had a better meal.
Excellent food and waitstaff. There was much more food than what I could eat, but it was outstanding.
I was the third person to the breakfast buffet and it looked like it had been prepared for hours.  Cold sausages , skinned over oatmeal.  Service however was top notch.
Very nice people
Hyatt can certainly use some upgrades to the food... Below average.
Prime rib special, deliciousness.

The breakfast was good, but calling it overpriced is an understatement. $16 for eggs and toast is simply absurd, no matter how good the butter is and how well the eggs are cooked. Do yourself a favor - if you want a fancy breakfast go to the French restaurant just around the corner. If you want something cheaper, there's a corner bakery less than 3 min walk from the lobby.
Wow
No no no!!! Ate here two days in a row, horrible service!!! Don’t go!
Nice staff. Good food. Clean and modern ambient.
(Translated by Google) A sound advice, DO NOT GO !!!! It is more worth going hungry !!!  (Original) Un sano consejo, NO VAYA !!!!.Es más digno pasar hambre !!!
(Translated by Google) Don't go, seriously, don't. The service is horrible and the food even worse.  (Original) No vaya, en serio, no lo haga. El servicio es horrible y la comida aún peor.
Bad service, arrogant attitude.

Of all of the places to dine in the nation's capital, this is a great choice... but only if you are stranded at the hotel and you can't figure out how delivery works.  The wait staff, while friendly, is typically unprepared for any group larger than mom, dad, and 2.3 touristy urchins. The food is decent enough, but absolutely nothing memorable, and the prices are exorbitant (elegant given the quality). The buffet, when offered, is as significant disappointment, even when compared to the on-menu offerings.  That all being said, if what you want is to have a drink or six in the attached bar and hope that someone famous (and their security detail) will come by, you're in luck. Given the proximity to the Capitol, it's a rare day that one or more dignitaries aren't traipsing through the place.
Can't believe a hyatt offers such a poor experience.
VERY expensive!!!!  Food was good, service was fantastic, limited menu choices.  Did I mention VERY expensive!?
Not what I'd expect from a hotel restaurant. The food was salty and bland.
Very overpriced food in a hotel that doesn't even offer a free breakfast in a $200 room...

Awful.  Just absolutely terribly awful.  Or perhaps offel is a better description.  We had dinner here 5 years ago as we were attending an event in the hotel.  It was bad then and even worse now.  I regret giving them a second chance.  It started out with a $30 round of drinks.  That is one dark and stormy and one glass of red wine (from a $30 retail bottle), both served in 4oz. plastic tumblers.  The wine was obviously corked and had also sat opened way to long from the strong vinegar smell and taste.  We complained about the wine and it was replaced, but it still showed up on our check and they would not remove when we complained.  So really it was a $45 round of drinks!  There was no bar service from the table.  Soda and water only.  If we wanted wine with the meal, we had to elbow our way across the lobby and get it ourselves.  The water was splashed in equal measure into our glasses and across the table into our laps without care or apology.  That is after the empty water glasses were slammed onto the table rudely interrupting our conversation.  The bread arrived, which was by far the highlight of the evening.  I ordered the buffet while my dining companion order a entree salad and the calamari appetizer.  I chose to hold off on hitting the buffet so we could eat together.  Surprising, but the app and the entree arrived at the same time, so after sharing the app, my companion was almost completely done before I even got to the buffet.  Horrible timing, especially when they attempted to bus our table and take the remaining app and bread while we were still eating it, forks in hand.  And the buffet; unseasoned, flavorless, dry, uninspired... Shall I go on?  Caesar salad but no croutons, roast beast (beef I hope) cooked to a leathery texture and served in a flavorless gravy swimming in fat, turkey breast and stuffing lacking in any glaze, seasonings, or natural flavor.  The side pastas were overcooked and unsauced.  Total for the evening was $120 plus tax and tip for two diners.  I had pizza latter that night to get the bad taste out of my mouth.  Just stay away and walk a block to any of 20 restaurants available to you in the neighborhood.  The food court at Union Station would serve you better.

Pretty weak place. Ambiance is what you would expect as it’s located in the atrium of the Hyatt regency. Food was mediocre at best. I got the skirt steak and it was edible. A bit too much salt and pepper. Potatoes were not seasoned at all. Asparagus was not seasoned well. Service was decent. Wouldn’t recommend for the prices they are charging.

Insanely overpriced breakfast buffet. $240 for 4 adults, 5 kids. Ihop would have been better. It would have cost $100 and the food would have been much better. Their buffet was not worth getting seconds of anything.
Great place to have brunch love it go all the time.

The restaurant is in the lobby where anyone can walk in. It is loud. The food was very mediocre. They brought my friend the wrong fries. She hated her meal and didn't eat it. Never going here again. Awful.
A bit pricy for the quality of the food. Good for a quick sit down meal
Great service and food!
Staffs wrer super nice, and food was OK but little pricy.

This is a good choice especially, if you are staying at the Hyatt hotel.  Not only for the ease and proximity (located in the lobby of the hotel), but also because the food and service are very good.  I had the opportunity to eat several meals here during my stay at the Hyatt, and was pleased with each meal.  The rib eye was excellent as well as their cobb salad and breakfast buffet.  I would highly recommend this restaurant and feel it exceeds the level of other choices close by.

Buffet is "okay". Could be much better and varied for the price tag. Service is unbelievably slow in the bar in the evenings - like, waiting 45 for a glass of wine slow. But the reason this place got 2-Star rating is because of the guy that seats people. Older grumpy guy who gives everyone the stink eye, including the wait staff. Speaks curtly and rudely to diners and bosses around staff in front of customers. Really unpleasant to be around.
Overpriced,  presentation lacking,  salmon dry
Batman doesn't like it so u won't like it too.
Brunch items were pretty good. Everything was reasonably priced, and location very convenient for those staying at the hotel.
The hotel itself was good. The location is ideal. The food/drinks/stores inside the hotel are extremely overpriced. The food was no where near worth what they charge.
